intro: Saccoloma caudatum, commonly known as the long-tailed fern, is a tropical plant native to regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its long, drooping fronds that give it its common name. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with creeping underground stems that allow it to spread and form dense colonies. Its leaves are typically dark green and have a leathery texture, which helps it retain moisture in its humid, shaded habitat. Saccoloma caudatum is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
